sources.title: Wild Guitar (1962)
sources.description: Wild Guitar is a 1962 film starring Arch Hall Jr. as Bud Eagle, Arch Hall Sr. as Mike McCauley, Ray Dennis Steckler as Steak, and Nancy Czar as Vickie Wills. The movie was directed by Ray Dennis Steckler and was produced by Arch Hall Sr. The film was targeted towards the drive-in market, and is generally regarded as a B-movie, but has become infamous as part of a series of films made by Arch Hall Sr., which starred his son, Arch Hall Jr. The screenplay was written by Arch Hall Sr., Joe Thomas, and Bob Wehling, and the musical director was a high school friend of Arch Hall Jr., the young Alan O'Day, who went on to #1 pop hits in the 1970s.

sources.title: Wild Guitar
sources.description: Except for the fact that it stars Arch Hall, Jr., who's as cute as a warthog and as convincing an actor as Tor Johnson, this is a fairly entertaining little jukebox musical. Bud Eagle comes to Hollywood from Spearfish, South Dakota, signs with a sleazy agent, and becomes a big star. There's also a cute girl who can't act a lick, and a heavy in the form of Steak, played by Cash Flagg (really Ray Dennis Steckler, who directed). There's also some interesting camera work now and then (Vilmos Zsigmond did 2nd Unit photography here), and a truly surreal closing number that has to be seen to be believed. The file uploaded is a reasonably clear XviD AVI.

sources.title: Wild Guitar (1962)
sources.description: A young rock & roll hopeful is given a shot at the big time by the unscrupulous owner of a small record company. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/wild-guitar-1962/

sources.title: Wild Guitar (1962) ARCH HALL JR.
sources.description:
Movie School by PizzaFLIX: Arch Hall Jr. is an American actor and musician who appeared in six indie films during the 1960s all produced by Nicholas Merriwether, the pseudonym of his father Arch Hall Sr.

Stars: Arch Hall Jr., Nancy Czar, Arch Hall Sr , and Ray Dennis Steckler
Director: Ray Dennis Steckler

After a hick hipster rolls into Hollywood on his motorbike with just a cheap guitar and a suitcase, he stumbles onto a TV talent show and is an immediate sensation. He is quickly signed and exploited by a big manager, but soon wises up and fights back!

sources.title: Wild Guitar (1962) Arch Hall Jr - Comedy, Drama, Musical Movie
sources.description:
He Was A Country Boy But He Played The Wildest Strings In This Mad-Mad Town 
A young Arch Hall, Jr. is given a shot at the big time by the unscrupulous owner of a small record company played by Arch Hall, Sr. (aka William Watters).

Director: Ray Dennis Steckler
Writers: Arch Hall Sr. (as Nicholas Merriwether), Bob Wehling 
Stars: Arch Hall Jr., Nancy Czar, Arch Hall Sr. 
Genres: Classics, Comedy, Drama, Music, Romance

metadata.Plot: Aspiring singer Bud meets dancer Vickie. He signs with shady manager McCauley. Bud achieves success but faces manipulation. Kidnapped, he reconciles with Vickie, confronts McCauley with evidence, forcing honest management.
metadata.Writer: Arch Hall Sr., Bob Wehling, Joe Thomas
metadata.Actors: Arch Hall Jr., Nancy Czar, Arch Hall Sr.
